radiographic_examinations.findings: One proviral integration site was found, located on the short arm of chromosome 11 within the LMO-2 locus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At a routine checkup 30 months after gene therapy, lymphocytosis consisting of a monoclonal population of V9/Vd1, g/n T cells of mature phenotype was detected. Between 30 and 34 months after gene therapy, the patient's lymphocyte count rose to 300,000 per cubic millimeter, and hepatosplenomegaly developed.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Further investigations showed the presence of a t(6;13) translocation, which had not been detected 30 months after the therapy.
